comments.html:
Great post and lessons. I just had an outage in my small office in NY recently used my labs UPS to carry me for a bit. And I have been in your shoes in the past so I empathize what you went through and we get some harsh winters/ice storms etc too. In your case if for tactical reasons you could have just had some long extension cords, space heaters etc to deploy a temp distribution system from generator to house to heaters/lights without messing with inside wiring mess from contractor. Ugly but quick, easy, mobile and functional.

Stay warm
comments.name: Jsicuran

comments.html:
Lesson here is the same as always: if you want something done right, you have to do it yourself. They'll of course tell you that you must hire a licensed electrician, a licensed plumber and a licensed supervizor a licensed banker to finance the operation, etc, etc. But again, if you want things to work at the end of the day . . . there is simply no alternative but to do all the critical parts of the project yourself.
No, i'm not a DIY maniac. I do hire people when i have to. But when I need a "life support system" i do it myself, even if it takes a long time to get educated and to implement. This approach has not failed me so far and yes, I do lose power from time to time, sometimes for a week or more.
